Token.Abstract: The RKDynamicMapping class is an RKMapping subclass that provides an interface for deferring the decision about how a given object representation is to be mapped until run time. This enables many interesting mapping strategies, such as mapping similarly structured data differently and constructing object mappings at run time by examining the data being mapped.
Sets a block to be invoked to determine the appropriate concrete object mapping with which to map an object representation.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: The block object to invoke to select the object mapping with which to map the given object representation. The block returns an object mapping and accepts a single parameter: the object representation being mapped.

Token.Abstract: Returns the array of matchers objects added to the receiver.
Returns the array of matchers objects added to the receiver.
Adds a matcher to the receiver.

Parameter.Name: matcher
Parameter.Abstract: The matcher to add to the receiver.

Token.Abstract: Removes a matcher from the receiver.

Parameter.Name: matcher
Parameter.Abstract: The matcher to remove from the receiver.

Token.Abstract: Returns an array of object mappings that have been registered with the receiver.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An array of RKObjectMapping objects registered with the receiver.

Token.Abstract: Returns an array of object mappings that have been registered with the receiver.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An array of RKObjectMapping objects registered with the receiver.

Token.Abstract: Invoked by the RKMapperOperation and RKMappingOperation to determine the appropriate RKObjectMapping to use when mapping the given object representation.

Parameter.Name: representation
Parameter.Abstract: The object representation that being mapped dynamically for which to determine the appropriate concrete mapping.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The object mapping to be used to map the given object representation.
